item.title: 2009 年以来英国住房开工率最低揭示工党面临的挑战
item.description: 英国新一届工党政府上台之初，英格兰的房屋开工率创下了近 15 年来最差的 12 个月，这凸显了新政府在推动建筑业繁荣方面所面临的巨大挑战。【原文：The UK’s new Labour government entered office off the back of the worst 12 months for housing starts in England in almost 15 years, underscoring the scale of the challenge it faces to spur a construction boom.】

item.title: 航空公司创新 "羞辱跳线者 "的科学方法
item.description: 美国航空公司正在试用一种新的技术功能来识别剪线工人。但首先...【原文：American Airlines is trying out a new technology feature to identify line cutters. But first...】

item.title: 普洛斯出售中国业务股份被指陷入僵局
item.description: 据熟悉情况的人士透露，由于在交易条款上存在分歧，向粤海控股有限公司出售普洛斯中国业务股份的谈判陷入僵局。【原文：Negotiations on the sale of a stake in GLP Pte’s China operations to Guangdong Holdings Ltd. have stalled due to disagreements over deal terms, according to people familiar with the situation.】

item.title: 仿人机器人初创公司 Agility 接近达成融资 1.5 亿美元的交易
item.description:
该公司已在亚马逊仓库中测试其双腿机器人。【原文：

The company is already testing its two-legged robots in Amazon warehouses. 

】

item.title: Synopsys 340 亿美元 Ansys 交易接受英国反垄断审查
item.description: 芯片设计公司 Synopsys Inc. 以 340 亿美元收购软件开发商 Ansys Inc.【原文：Chip-design firm Synopsys Inc.’s $34 billion takeover of software developer Ansys Inc. will be investigated by the UK’s antitrust watchdog.】

item.title: 德国商业银行称杰富瑞持有其超过 5%的投票权
item.description: 德国商业银行（Commerzbank AG）披露，杰富瑞金融集团（Jefferies Financial Group Inc.【原文：Commerzbank AG disclosed that Jefferies Financial Group Inc. controls 5.33% of its voting rights, adding to a number of investment banks with financial instruments in the German lender.】

item.title: 通胀持续，俄罗斯将关键利率上调至创纪录的 21
item.description: 俄罗斯央行将其关键利率上调至历史新高，超过了总统弗拉基米尔-普京下令入侵乌克兰后实施的水平，决策者们正在努力应对持续的物价增长。【原文：The Bank of Russia hiked its key rate to a record high, surpassing the level it imposed after President Vladimir Putin ordered the invasion of Ukraine, as policymakers grapple with persistent price growth.】

item.title: 预算需求增长，波兰寻求吸引债券投资者
item.description: 波兰财政部长安杰伊-多曼斯基（Andrzej Domanski）表示，欧元区需求疲软导致的经济逆风被认为是暂时的，因此全球固定收益投资者对波兰的兴趣正在增加。【原文：Poland is enjoying increased interest from global fixed income investors as economic headwinds — fueled by weak demand from the euro region — are seen as temporary, according to Finance Minister Andrzej Domanski.】

item.title: 收益率飙升刺破股票交易者连续六周的涨势
item.description: 债券收益率的快速攀升令投资者着迷，加剧了市场的波动性，现在可能成为风险资产的主要牺牲品：S&P 500 指数连续六周上涨。许多人希望大量现金从货币市场账户中融化出来，为股市提供新的动力，而现在却出现了大量现金冰川，这是为什么呢？【原文：A rapid runup in bond yields is obsessing investors, stoking volatility, and now may claim a major casualty in risk assets: the six-week streak of gains in the S&P 500. For a clue as to why, consider the massive glacier of cash that many hoped was poised to melt out of money market accounts and provide fresh impetus for stocks.】

item.title: 美国银行哈特内特称美国大选前黄金押注上升
item.description: 美国银行（Bank of America Corp）的策略师表示，投资者在美国大选前继续增持黄金，以对冲通胀和民粹主义。【原文：Investors are continuing to load up on gold ahead of the US election as a hedge against inflation and populism, according to strategists at Bank of America Corp.】

item.title: Vedanta 在近期融资后获得穆迪评级上调
item.description: 周五，穆迪评级公司（Moody's Ratings）将印度亿万富翁阿尼尔-阿加瓦尔（Anil Agarwal）的矿业集团韦丹塔资源有限公司（Vedanta Resources Ltd.）的债券评级上调，理由是该公司最近成功地获得了融资。【原文：Bonds of Indian billionaire Anil Agarwal’s mining group Vedanta Resources Ltd. were upgraded on Friday by Moody’s Ratings, which cited the company’s recent successful efforts to access funding.】

item.title: 两极分化的输油管道法在玉米种植大州被列入选票
item.description: 一条耗资 89 亿美元的碳捕集管道提案使美国玉米带两极分化，目前正面临最大的障碍之一：选举日。【原文：A proposed $8.9-billion carbon-capture pipeline that has polarized the US Corn Belt is facing one of its biggest obstacles yet: Election Day.】

item.title: Bally 价值 18 亿美元的芝加哥赌场取决于业主的重新设计
item.description: 几个月来，赌场业资深人士彼得-卡利诺（Peter Carlino）一直在考虑是否支持百利公司（Bally's Corp）获准在芝加哥市中心建造的大型赌博度假村。【原文：For months, casino industry veteran Peter Carlino pondered whether to back the massive gambling resort Bally’s Corp. won approval to build in downtown Chicago.】

item.title: 花旗称对冲基金在英国预算案公布前抛售英镑
item.description: 据花旗集团（Citigroup Inc.【原文：Foreign exchange markets are positioning for further sterling weakness ahead of the UK budget on Wednesday, with both hedge funds and asset managers continuing to sell the currency, according to Citigroup Inc.】

item.title: 欧洲央行押注欧元，欧元将创二月以来最长单周跌幅
item.description: 受欧洲央行可能在 12 月降息半个基点的预期不断升温的打压，欧元兑美元汇率将创下八个月来最长的单周跌幅。【原文：The euro is on course for its longest weekly slide against the dollar in eight months, pressured by growing expectations that the European Central Bank may deliver a half-point interest-rate cut in December.】

item.title: 英国开发银行 BII 表示，非洲电力传输将迎来投资浪潮
item.description: 英国开发银行英国国际投资公司（British International Investment）表示，电网对扩大非洲能源供应和向清洁能源过渡至关重要，政府应做好准备，迎接日益增长的资金浪潮。【原文：Power grids vital to expanding access to energy in Africa and transitioning to cleaner sources are poised for a growing wave of funding that governments should prepare for, according to the UK development bank British International Investment.】

item.title: 欧洲央行武契奇表示对 12 月利率决定持开放态度
item.description: 欧洲中央银行管理委员会成员鲍里斯-武伊契奇（Boris Vujcic）说，他还没有决定在今年最后一次利率会议上应达成什么样的结果。【原文：European Central Bank Governing Council member Boris Vujcic said he hasn’t decided what outcome should be reached at the final interest-rate meeting of the year.】

item.title: 斯塔默希望通过英国引领人工智能的计划赢得怀疑论者的支持
item.description:
英国首相将自己定位为人工智能的拥护者，而在此之前，工党在人工智能问题上的承诺曾一度令人困惑。【原文：

UK’s prime minister is positioning himself as a champion for AI after some early confusion around Labour’s commitment to the issue. 

】

item.title: Arm 首席执行官认为人工智能改变世界的速度比互联网快得多
item.description:
Arm控股公司首席执行官雷内-哈斯（Rene Haas）表示，人工智能的影响将 "相当、相当巨大"，智能汽车的发展势不可挡。【原文：

Rene Haas, the chief executive officer of Arm Holdings, says AI’s impact will be ‘quite, quite dramatic’ and there’s no holding back smart cars.

】

item.title: 土耳其考虑终止股票卖空禁令
item.description: 熟悉内情的人士说，土耳其官员正在讨论放宽股票卖空禁令，希望吸引更多海外资金流入。【原文：Turkish officials are discussing easing a ban on short-selling of equities in hopes of attracting more overseas inflows, people familiar with the matter said.】

item.title: 中国拘留阿斯利康前高管，表明调查范围扩大
item.description: 据当地媒体周五报道，中国当局正在调查阿斯利康公司（AstraZeneca Plc）的一名前高级管理人员，这表明中国政府正在扩大对这家英国制药巨头在中国大陆业务的审查。【原文：Chinese authorities are probing a former senior executive of AstraZeneca Plc in the country, local media outlets reported on Friday, in a sign Beijing is widening its scrutiny of the British pharmaceutical giant’s operations in mainland China.】

item.title: 欧洲央行西姆库斯希望降息，但无法证明降息半点是合理的
item.description: 欧洲中央银行管理委员会成员格迪米纳斯-西姆库斯（Gediminas Simkus）说，人们不应该纠结于 12 月可能降息的幅度，因为借贷成本最终会降到什么程度才是更重要的问题。【原文：European Central Bank Governing Council member Gediminas Simkus said people shouldn’t obsess over the size of a probable interest-rate cut in December, since the question of where borrowing costs will end up is more important.】

item.title: 德国经济趋于稳定，商业前景有所改善
item.description: 德国 10 月份的商业前景有所改善，进一步证明该国的经济衰退可能正在结束。【原文：Germany’s business outlook improved in October — adding to evidence that the country’s economic downturn may be ending.】

item.title: 关于波音公司持续混乱的更多信息
item.description:
采访理查德-阿布拉菲亚。【原文：

Catching up with Richard Aboulafia.

】

item.title: 关于波音公司持续混乱的更多信息
item.description: 波音公司/摄影师：安德鲁-哈勒/布鲁姆伯格【原文：Boeing Co/The Photographer: Andrew Harrer/Bloomberg】

item.title: 欧洲央行称上个月消费者通胀预期持续下降
item.description: 欧洲中央银行（European Central Bank —）的数据显示，欧元区消费者的通胀预期在9月份继续下降，这让政策制定者进一步确信，他们可能会比之前想象的更快达到目标。【原文：Inflation expectations of consumers in the euro zone continued declining in September, according to the European Central Bank — giving policymakers further confidence that they may reach their target sooner than previously thought.】

item.title: 大流行时代结束，奢侈品财富缩水 580 亿美元
item.description: 大流行时期，法国奢侈品和化妆品巨头的财富达到了前所未有的高度，消费者纷纷抢购价格不菲的手袋、礼服和美容产品。【原文：The wealth of France’s luxury and cosmetics titans swelled to unprecedented heights during the pandemic era, when consumers snapped up pricey handbags, gowns and grooming products.】

item.title: 如果税收获得批准，西班牙 Cepsa 公司将停止在绿色氢气上的投资
item.description: 西班牙的 Cepsa 公司表示，它可能会削减绿色氢气项目的开支，这是本周第三家欧洲炼油企业审查其减排所需技术的计划。【原文：Spain’s Cepsa said it could curb spending on green hydrogen projects, the third European oil refiner this week to review its plans on the technology needed to cut emissions.】

item.title: 一系列抛硬币时刻将考验股票投资者的胆量
item.description: 股票投资者面临着一连串难以预测的结果和令人困惑的市场信号。耐心和稳健看起来是在嘈杂中穿行的宝贵品质。【原文：Equity investors face a bewildering sequence of tough-to-predict outcomes and confusing market signals. Patience and a steady hand look like valuable attributes in navigating through the noise.】

item.title: 肖尔茨承诺加强与印度的贸易往来以遏制中国的主导地位
item.description: 德国总理奥拉夫-肖尔茨（Olaf Scholz）呼吁进一步实现国家贸易多样化，他希望减少德国经济对中国的依赖，转而支持印度。【原文：German Chancellor Olaf Scholz called for further diversification of the nation’s trade as he looks to reduce the economy’s dependence on China in favor of India.】
